Job_Description: อาจารย์ประจำ สาขาวิชาธุรกิจเกมและอีสปอร์ต คณะวิทยาศาสตร์และเทคโนโลยี (สาขาวิชานี้ร่วมกับคณะบริหารธุรกิจ) ภาระหน้าที่ สอนในรายวิชาที่เกี่ยวข้องสาขาวิชาธุรกิจเกมและอีสปอร์ต ของคณะวิทยาศาสตร์และเทคโนโลยี งานวิจัยทางวิชาการ งานหลักสูตรสาขาวิชา อาจารย์ที่ปรึกษา งานอื่น ๆ ที่ได้รับมอบหมาย คุณสมบัติ สำเร็จการศึกษาระดับปริญญาโท ด้านบริหารธุรกิจ, การตลาด, การจัดการอีเว้นท์, ดิจิทัลอาร์ท หรือสาขาวิชาที่เกี่ยวข้อง (กรณี สำเร็จการศึกษาระดับปริญญาโท มีเงื่อนไข ให้ยื่นเสนอผลงานเพื่อขอตำแหน่งทางวิชาการ ระดับผู้ช่วยศาสตราจารย์ขึ้นไป ภายใน 30 วัน หลังจากปฏิบัติงานครบ 4 ปี นับตั้งแต่วันที่เริ่มจ้าง และได้รับอนุมัติแต่งตั้งให้ดำรงตำแหน่งทางวิชาการระดับผู้ช่วยศาสตราจารย์ขึ้นไป) มีผลการทดสอบภาษาอังกฤษอย่างใดอย่างหนึ่ง ดังต่อไปนี้ คะแนนสอบ TOEFL ตั้งแต่ 61 ขึ้นไป (Internet-Based) หรือ คะแนนสอบ IELTS ไม่ต่ำกว่า 5.0 หรือ คะแนน TOEIC ไม่น้อยกว่า 600 หรือ คะแนน UTCC BEST ไม่ต่ำกว่า 485 ทั้งนี้ผลการสอบภาษาอังกฤษตามที่ระบุไว้ข้างต้น ต้องมีอายุไม่เกิน 2 ปี หรือ มีผลทดสอบความสามารถภาษาอังกฤษตามเกณฑ์มาตรฐานอื่น ที่สามารถเทียบเท่าหรือทดแทนที่ระบุไว้ข้างต้น หรือ กรณีที่ได้รับการยกเว้น โดยไม่ต้องใช้ผลทดสอบภาษาอังกฤษ มีดังนี้ (กรณีใดก็ได้) สำเร็จการศึกษาจากหลักสูตรนานาชาติ สำเร็จการศึกษาจากต่างประเทศ ได้รับการบรรจุเป็นอาจารย์ประจำในสถาบันอุดมศึกษาอื่น มีผลงานทางวิชาการที่ได้รับการเผยแพร่ในวารสารวิชาการ ***หากมีประสบการณ์ในอุตสาหกรรมเกม หรืออุตสาหกรรมแอนิเมชั่น การใช้โปรแกรมต่าง ๆ การได้รับราลวัลจากงานประกวดต่าง ๆ และ/หรือ ประสบการณ์ในการสอนระดับมหาวิทยาลัย จะได้รับการพิจารณาเป็นพิเศษ*** สามารถส่งหลักฐานการสมัครได้ที่นี่ หรือส่งทาง E-Mail หรือยื่นใบสมัครตามแบบที่มหาวิทยาลัยกำหนดด้วยตนเองที่สำนักบริหารทรัพยามนุษย์ในวันและเวลาทำการ ติดต่อ สำนักบริหารทรัพยากรมนุษย์ อาคาร 10 ชั้น 5 มหาวิทยาลัยหอการค้าไทย ทุกวันจันทร์ถึงศุกร์ เวลา 8.30 - 17.00 http://department.utcc.ac.th/hr/

JOB PURPOSE: Learning Assistants from Pre-EY to Year 4 work under the supervision of the Class teacher with a focus of supporting children in their learning. Our Learning Assistants will support the ongoing progress and development of pupils by working in collaboration with Class Teachers. Under the guidance of the teacher, they also take a key role in ensuring a safe and engaging learning environment. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Curriculum To develop a knowledge and understanding of how to support children in their learning and to be a facilitator of learning. To develop an understanding of the specific needs of children to be supported. To support the teacher in providing support for learning both in group situations and individually, inside and outside of the classroom. To support planning where appropriate and ensure lesson objectives are understood and drive learning. Job_Description: อาจารย์ประจำ สาขาวิชาภาษาเกาหลี คณะมนุษยศาสตร์ ภาระหน้าที่ สอนในรายวิชาที่เกี่ยวข้องสาขาวิชาภาษาเกาหลี คณะมนุษยศาสตร์ งานวิจัยทางวิชาการ งานหลักสูตรสาขาวิชา อาจารย์ที่ปรึกษา งานอื่น ๆ ที่ได้รับมอบหมาย คุณสมบัติผู้สมัคร สำเร็จการศึกษาระดับปริญญาเอก/โท สาขาวิชาภาษาเกาหลี การสอนภาษาเกาหลี ภาษาศาสตร์ ภาษาศาสตร์และสังคม เกาหลีศึกษา หรือสาขาที่เกี่ยวข้อง (กรณี สำเร็จการศึกษาระดับปริญญาโท มีเงื่อนไข ให้ยื่นเสนอผลงานเพื่อขอตำแหน่งทางวิชาการ ระดับผู้ช่วยศาสตราจารย์ขึ้นไป ภายใน 30 วัน หลังจากปฏิบัติงานครบ 4 ปี นับตั้งแต่วันที่เริ่มจ้าง และได้รับอนุมัติแต่งตั้งให้ดำรงตำแหน่งทางวิชาการระดับผู้ช่วยศาสตราจารย์ขึ้นไป) ผลการทดสอบภาษาอังกฤษอย่างใดอย่างหนึ่ง ดังต่อไปนี้ คะแนนสอบ TOEFL ตั้งแต่ 61 ขึ้นไป (Internet-Based) หรือ คะแนนสอบ IELTS ไม่ต่ำกว่า 5.0 หรือ คะแนน TOEIC ไม่น้อยกว่า 600 หรือ คะแนน UTCC BEST ไม่ต่ำกว่า 485 ทั้งนี้ผลการสอบภาษาอังกฤษตามที่ระบุไว้ข้างต้น ต้องมีอายุไม่เกิน 2 ปี หรือ มีผลทดสอบความสามารถภาษาอังกฤษตามเกณฑ์มาตรฐานอื่น ที่สามารถเทียบเท่าหรือทดแทนที่ระบุไว้ข้างต้น หรือ กรณีที่ได้รับการยกเว้น โดยไม่ต้องใช้ผลทดสอบภาษาอังกฤษ มีดังนี้ (กรณีใดก็ได้) สำเร็จการศึกษาจากหลักสูตรนานาชาติ สำเร็จการศึกษาจากต่างประเทศ ได้รับการบรรจุเป็นอาจารย์ประจำในสถาบันอุดมศึกษาอื่น ***หากมีประสบการณ์สอนภาษาเกาหลีในระดับมหาวิทยาลัย จะได้รับการพิจารณาเป็นพิเศษ*** สามารถส่งหลักฐานการสมัครได้ที่นี่ หรือส่งทาง E-Mail หรือยื่นใบสมัครตามแบบที่มหาวิทยาลัยกำหนดด้วยตนเองที่สำนักบริหารทรัพยามนุษย์ในวันและเวลาทำการ ติดต่อ สำนักบริหารทรัพยากรมนุษย์ อาคาร 10 ชั้น 5 มหาวิทยาลัยหอการค้าไทย ทุกวันจันทร์ถึงศุกร์ เวลา 8.30 - 17.00 http://department.utcc.ac.th/hr/ [link removed]

ลักษณะงาน ทำหน้าที่ฝึกอบรม ติดตามและประเมินผลการฝึกอบรมของฝ่ายปฎิบัติการพนักงานของพนักงานในองค์กร  เพื่อให้การทำงานของพนักงานมีประสิทธิภาพและประสิทธิผล ออกแบบ และจัดเตรียมอุปกรณ์และเครื่องมือในการฝึกอบรม ดูแลการใช้งานด้านเทคนิคต่าง ๆ วิเคราะห์ และสรุปผลการฝึกอบรม และนำผลสรุปมาพัฒนาร่วมกับผู้บังคับบัญชา และงานอื่นๆ ที่ได้มอบหมาย คุณสมบัติ วุฒิการศึกษาปริญญาตรี-ปริญญาโท ทุกสาขา มีความรู้ด้านระบบ ISO มีประสบการณ์ด้านการฝึกอบรมโดยเฉพาะทางด้าน Sales , Engineer , Technician ขยันอดทน ทำงานในสภาวะกดดันได้ มีทักษะการสื่อสารที่ดีเยี่ยม มีทักษะการทำ Presentation เสนอผู้บริหาร สามารถเริ่มงานได้ทันทีจะพิจารณาเป็นพิเศษ

Report to: Nursing Manager The Role: The role of the school nurse is to maintain/improve the health and wellbeing of our students, thus enabling them to benefit fully from their educational experiences; and, to promote the optimum healthy lifestyle for all students through the combined efforts of the home, school and community. Responsibilities: Assist in the development and implementation of a health programme, and maintenance of a safe and healthful environment. Disseminate health education information to teachers, parents and students, and provide direct classroom instruction when needed. Assist the academic staff in the development of a health education curriculum. Make appropriate health appraisals of referred students and provide health counselling to students and their parents when necessary. Provide vision, auditory and scoliosis screening of students in compliance with health screening mandates and conduct follow-up of all deficiencies by assisting parents in making plans for further examinations and correction. Keep accurate records of activities at assigned schools; and establish and maintain necessary student health records. Record the results of health screenings and other significant health information in cumulative records. Complete a health/development evaluation on those students referred to special education when specified in an assessment plan. Serve as a member of the Individualized Education Plan team to report results of health/development evaluations and provide health related information. Assist in the control and prevention of communicable disease by providing information to staff, students and parents about protective measures against communicable disease. Establish contact with appropriate members of the medical community as part of follow-up procedures of chronic and communicable disease cases. Work with and act as liaison to school health committees, country health officials and other agencies concerned with the health and welfare of students. Provide emergency care and First Aid treatment for serious accidents and illnesses which occur at school. Oversee and develop policies and procedures in conjunction with the Bursar and School Manager. Work with the school caterers to provide information on healthy eating, monitor obesity and dietary requirements, and ensure the menu is balanced and nutritious. Administer the student vaccinations and maintain records. Perform other duties as assigned. Requirements: Registered nurse or licensed practical nurse with first aid and CPR certification. Pediatric experience preferred for those assigned to the elementary schools or middle school. Experience of working in accident and emergency frontline services is desirable. 2 years’ work experience as a School Nurse in an International School would be helpful. Safeguarding and Legal Please note the College’s positions are subject to an enhanced Criminal Records Bureau. The College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. Wellington College International Bangkok is also committed to equality and diversity. Candidates should be aware that all posts in the College involve a degree of responsibility for safeguarding students.

● Assess, record and report on the development, progress and attainment of students; ● Set high expectations which inspire, motivate and challenge students; ● Promote the general progress and well-being of individual students and of any class or group of students assigned; Curriculum ● Plan and implement engaging, innovative lessons, including the production of schemes of work, taking into account where appropriate, any national guidance to ensure all syllabus requirements are followed; ● Ensure that high academic standards are expected and the highest standard of teaching and learning is maintained in one’s own classroom. Assessment and Reports ● Make accurate and productive use of assessment, providing or contributing oral and written assessments, reports and references relating to individual students and groups of students; ● Use relevant data to monitor, progress, set targets and plan subsequent lessons; ● Give students regular feedback, both orally and through accurate marking of work, where applicable. Staff ● Engage with and support other members of the department, including support staff; ● Contribute to effective communication and a unified sense of purpose within the department; ● Establish good communication with other departments, including Learning Support staff, EAL staff, librarians and senior staff; ● Provide cover for other staff in line with the School’s cover procedure. Administration ● Manage issued resources in accordance with the School's policies and procedures; ● Ensure that assessment of students' work within the department is regular, thorough, and follows the departmental marking policy; ● Prepare for assessment and/or examinations (internal and external) and liaise with staff responsible for their organisation; ● Maintain departmental records; ● Ensure that departmental stock and equipment are well cared for and economically used. General School Responsibilities Appraisal and Professional Development ● To participate in the staff appraisal and professional development programme; ● To undertake such training as may be reasonably required by the School to adapt to the changing requirements of the School or as may be necessary to fulfil the School's statutory or regulatory obligations; ● To undertake mandated job-related training as required by the School; ● To be aware of and support relevant school policies, handbooks, and procedures. Other Responsibilities ● To take responsibility for promoting and safeguarding the welfare of children and young people within the school. ● To uphold and promote all aspects of the Child Protection and Safeguarding policies. ● To act on aspects of student welfare and safeguarding raising any concerns by following school protocol/procedures.Support the pastoral care policy of the school as a Form Tutor. ● Attend school lunch and take a table. ● Contribute to the Activities programme according to experience and qualifications. ● Undertake such other reasonable duties from time to time as the School may reasonably require. Person Specification Personal Qualities ● Enthusiastic with a sound understanding of best practice ● Flexible and adaptable ● Proactive in all aspects of School life through participation and support ● Creative and innovative across and beyond the curriculum ● Able to work successfully under pressure with excellent organisational skills ● Reliable and respectful at all times ● Able to present a professional image in line with the high expectations of Rugby School Thailand ● An effective communicator both orally and in writing ● A confident and competent user of technology in the classroom and for administrative purposes Essential ● University degree from a recognised institution ● Teaching Qualification from a recognized academic institution ● Knowledge of the UK education system ● At least 1 year’s teaching experience of Prep school age groups ● Working knowledge of the national curriculum Desirable ● Knowledge of the UK prep school system ● Knowledge of international education ● Experience within a UK Prep school ● Experience within a UK boarding school ● Experience working with children who have English as a second language

A newly expanded Primary School with Kindergarten, located west of the city, only a short distance (10 minutes) from the BTS (Skytrain) with easy access to the world-famous, historic and vibrant city of Bangkok! The area and local community are steeped in Thai tradition, set in lush greenery with a tranquil, peaceful atmosphere. In August 2024 we will open our Brand new Primary School building, starting with Years 1, 2 and 3, this will be a very exciting time to join our school team. The school follows the EYFS and UK National Curriculum for children from 2 – 11 years. We are an award-winning, high profile school receiving the British Chamber of Commerce Thailand, “Outstanding Small Business” award (2018) and the National Day Nurseries Association (NDNA) “Best International Nursery” award (2019). We are also the only International Kindergarten to be awarded the NDNA’s Platinum level standard "Quality Counts" accreditation. The award-winning architectural design of the school, along with its educational ethos are profoundly unique and continue to attract government and educational attention from throughout SE Asia. With an exceptionally well-resourced Kindergarten with special indoor facilities, a soft gym, library, ICT facilities and a room for cookery classes. In addition, state-of-the-art outdoor facilities include a swimming pool, splash pool, sandpit, playground, racing track and garden area. Alongside this an newly built Primary School with brand new facilities including, swimming pool, football field, library and music rooms. The school aims to provide the highest standards of Primary Education in Thailand. We provide a small, very friendly and professional community atmosphere, with Continuing Professional Development for the teaching team, who are always central to our priorities. The atmosphere in the classes is one of warmth and security, a place where children can grow in confidence, ready to take on new challenges. Dedicated teachers work hard to create a stimulating environment through engaging activities and displays, and by following the children’s interests. The school embraces its community and parents play an active role as they too become part of the ‘Kensington Family.’ Parent participation is recognised as an integral part of the education process, and they work closely with teachers to organise many different cultural and social events throughout the year. Bangkok is an exciting, iconic city at the very heart of SE Asia and abounds with rich cultural experiences. Thailand offers excellent leisure and travel opportunities, with countries such as Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos, Malaysia and Myanmar, all just an hour away. The cost of living here is breathtakingly low and this wonderful ‘land of smiles’ has year-round warmth and sunshine. A beautiful, safe place to live and work, and a place that will stay in your heart forever! With an exceptional team of teachers at our Secondary School, students have achieved excellent IGCSE and A-Level exam results in recent years and are now studying at universities all around the world. Our Secondary School is ideally located a few minutes from Bearing BTS station. The very spacious and leafy campus offers very generous outdoor sports facilities, a huge Gymnasium, open-air Swimming Pool and modern classroom learning environments. From August 2025, we will be offering Primary schooling at this campus as well, with the construction of a brand new Primary School now being developed. The existing TSIS Primary School campus is conveniently located in the Wongwianyai District of Bangkok. The campus is an ideal environment for children aged 2-11 years to grow and learn together. It is equipped with academic, sporting and other extracurricular facilities that outshine many other international schools in the area. In addition to spacious classrooms, facilities incorporated in the design of the four-storey building include an assembly hall, air-conditioned gymnasium and dining hall. First-time visitors to the school are impressed by its beautiful, grassed playground and swimming pools. TSIS is a member of the Council of International Schools (CIS) and is fully accredited by WASC. Our team is proud to guide the holistic development of our students in a kind, caring, respectful and globally-minded environment which encourages students to drive their own learning.

Rugby School Thailand (RST), a co-educational day and boarding international School set in 80 acres of glorious Thai countryside south of Bangkok, opened in September 2017 with 110 students. The School has now grown to over 1,100 students and attracts students from all over Thailand and South East Asia. The structure, School day and ethos of RST are based upon the British Independent School model, rather than the standard international school model. As such, the School has three sections: Pre-Prep (2-6 year olds), Prep (7 – 12 year olds) and Senior (13 – 18 year olds). Rugby School Thailand is the first overseas sister school of Rugby School UK, one of the most prestigious and well-known schools in the UK. Rugby School Thailand shares Rugby School UK’s DNA in every important respect. It is unique. The health, safety and well-being of young people are of paramount importance to all the adults who work at Rugby School Thailand. Children have the right to protection, regardless of age, gender, race, culture, sexual orientation, or disability. They have a right to be safe in our School. Members of staff in the School have a legal and moral obligation to safeguard and promote the welfare of the students, taking all reasonable steps to protect them from harm whether from physical injury, abuse, neglect, emotional harm or from anything that interferes with their general development. About School/Department The Senior academic curriculum draws from the best of the UK National Curriculum. Each department offers either GCSE or IGCSE courses in E and D Block (Year 10 and 11). In the Sixth Form, Rugby School Thailand students study A Levels. There are currently around 300 in the Senior section of the School. Unlike other international schools, Rugby School Thailand operates longer School days with a wide variety of Enrichment activities. The Senior buildings are designed to offer an outstanding learning environment. The main buildings include a teaching block; state-of-the-art Design and Technology and Art and Design studios; ICT suites; Drama studios; a Black Box theatre; Music classrooms; seventeen music practice rooms; a recording studio; and a dance studio. A separate Science Centre houses 13 laboratories, and a lecture theatre. The Webb Ellis Centre houses both 50m and 25m swimming pools plus a warm up pool; an air-conditioned basketball stadium; a fitness suite; gymnasium; and two PE classrooms. Floodlit football fields and tennis courts complete the sports facilities. The Sixth Form Centre provides a hub for Year 12 and 13 students as they pursue independent and group study as they complete their A Levels. The Psychology Department The Psychology Department is housed in the purpose built and spacious Science Centre and with the subject being part of the Science department. Psychology has grown in popularity with there being two classes now in both Year 12 and Year 13. There is plenty of opportunity for the right candidate to grow the department as the School expands over the coming years. Closing Date: 16th February 2024 Application Process Long list and short list interviews will be held either in person at Rugby School Thailand or via Zoom or google meets. (Rugby School Thailand reserves the right to appoint by invitation before the closing date.) Qualifications, Identification, Health and Background Checks Rugby School Thailand is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all the students in our care and expects all applicants to share this commitment. You will be required to provide documentation for proof of your identity, including an attested (by a notary) birth certificate, and qualifications. If successful at interview the position will be offered subject to satisfactory references and police checks. For candidates who have worked and/or lived in the UK, we will request that you have an up to date ICPC and we will complete Prohibition Order Checks . We also require that anyone who has lived and worked in a country other than the UK for more than 6 months has a police check from the national checking agency. All references will be verified, we require a minimum of two references with one reference from your present or most recent employer. You may also be required, within the final appointment process, to undergo a health check. Rugby School Thailand is an equal opportunities employer.

A Secondary Science teacher is sought for Southern International School Hat Yai, a rapidly growing, co-educational, pre-school to age 18 Cambridge International School in the prosperous and friendly southern Thai city of Hat Yai. We are an accredited examination centre for Cambridge International Examinations and received the ISQM Silver accreditation through the Education Development Trust in June 2019.  We are also the first whole school with nursery in Thailand to be awarded the 'Quality Counts' mark at Platinum level, the highest possible level by the National Day Nurseries Association, (NDNA). Southern International School Hat Yai (SIH) is a young and ambitious school with a ‘can-do’ attitude and we are looking for a teacher who can bring a love of learning to the classroom, develop enquiring minds and inspire our students to achieve the best results possible. Requirements The successful applicant will: Be a qualified Key Stage 3 and 4 Science Teacher with appropriate teaching qualification (i.e. B.Ed. and/or PGCE) For this specific role, are looking for someone with confidence and a proven track record of outstanding results, teaching this subject to GCSE using the Cambridge specification An ability to offer A Level Physics or Chemistry is preferable Curriculum for England and Wales and its associated assessment practices Possess a strong focus on the pastoral care of children, understanding the balance between academic and social progress and support, as well as the ability to identify safeguarding concerns. Possess excellent interpersonal skills and a positive approach to both individual and collaborative professional development. Please upload an updated CV as part of your application. Our children are mostly Thai and from other Asian countries with parents who are committed to giving their children an international education. Our parents are extremely loyal and supportive and participate in many school events and activities. The successful candidate will be joining the school at an exciting period in its development. There are opportunities to develop yourself professionally and personally in a safe, happy, supportive environment. Hat Yai in Songkhla province has grown from a small but busy commercial town into a lively but manageable city of a little over a million, surrounded by rice paddies, forested hills and waterfalls. The tourist hot spots of Krabi, Trang and Phuket are easily accessible for long weekend trips, but there are several unspoiled destinations much closer to home. New upmarket bistros and restaurants are springing up seemingly overnight, adding to the cosmopolitan feel of this welcoming city. Accommodation is cheap and varied, from Thai-style houses to newly built, self-contained condominiums with shared swimming pools. Hat Yai is a wonderful, safe city that provides a great quality of life, and this partly explains why so many of our staff choose to renew their contracts. Please look at our Facebook page to get a feel for working in SIH and living in Southern Thailand. NOTE: We reserve the right to interview and offer to a strong candidate prior to the closing date. It is strongly recommended that candidates submit their applications as soon as possible. Southern International School is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. We are committed to Child Protection and successful candidates will undergo background checks using the International Child Protection Certificate (ICPC).

Inspirational teaching that delivers high standards of learning. Knowing the core knowledge is vital for students to approach learning with confidence and enjoyment, this is the ethos behind our curriculum here at TPIS. Rich learning experiences include problem -solving, hands on learning, challenge and communication. Teachers create a haven in which our students feel especially safe, valued, happy and respected. Candidate Profile:  The successful candidate: ● A fully qualified teacher. ● Ability to teach IGCSE and A Level an advantage. ● A dedicated teacher, with excellent subject knowledge, capable of inspiring students. ● Flexible and positive in approach. ● Be a team player. ● Able to build relationships with students, parents and colleagues. ● Have tireless energy and enthusiasm. ● Will be internationally minded and an innovator in the classroom. ● Have an up-to-date knowledge of the latest teaching research on curriculum and practices. ● Demonstrated the value of extracurricular activities in developing students’ character. The School: Tara Pattana International School is a community school at the centre of a rapidly developing area of Pattaya. The school delivers a British education with a global perspective. We understand that students learn best when they are happy and settled at school. The school has a real mix of international students that creates a spirit of internationalism based on diversity, respect and understanding. Living in Pattaya: The school is situated close to the centre of Pattaya, a lively and dynamic city on the east coast of Thailand. Pattaya is an exciting place to live and work. There are numerous excellent restaurants, attractions and shopping malls. There is easy access to the beautiful beaches of Koh Samet and Rayong for a holiday. Pattaya is within easy reach of Bangkok approximately 1.5hrs by car. Safeguarding: We take great care to safeguard children in the school. Applicants must have up to date police checks. This will include checks with previous employers as well as verification of original qualifications. How to Apply: Applications should be sent via email ( jswan@tpis.ac.th ) addressed to Mr. James Swan, Head of School, and include: ● A letter of application. ● Your Curriculum Vitae with a recent photograph. ● Full contact details of three referees (one of which must be your current Head of School) ● Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by the school. Further Details: Full details about the school are available on our website at www.tpis.ac.th

Job_Title: อาจารย์ ((อาจารย์อำนวยการเรียนการสอน) คณะการสร้างเจ้าของธุรกิจ)
Job_Description:
ตำแหน่ง อาจารย์ สังกัด/ตำแหน่งงานย่อยตามที่ลงประกาศ (อาจารย์อำนวยการเรียนการสอน) คณะการสร้างเจ้าของธุรกิจ หน้าที่ คุณสมบัติ 1.สำเร็จการศึกษาระดับปริญญาโท/เอก สาขาวิทยาศาสตรมหาบัณฑิต สาขาเทคโนโลยีสารสนเทศ หรือในสาขาอื่นๆ ที่เกี่ยวข้อง
2.มีประสบการณ์การและความเชี่ยวชาญในเนื้อหาทางด้านการจัดการเรียนการสอนสมัยใหม่
3. มีความสามารถในการใช้ภาษาอังกฤษ / หรือมีผลการทดสอบด้านภาษาอังกฤษ TOEIC ตั้งแต่ 550 คะแนนขึ้นไป
4. มีความสามารถในการเรียนรู้ การปรับตัว และการทำงานเป็นทีม
5. เป็นผู้มีความรับผิดชอบในหน้าที่และการปฎิบัติงาน 
6. มีความเข้าใจในด้านนวัตกรรมและมีความคิดสร้างสรรค์ โดยมุ่งเน้นความเข้าใจพื้นฐานทางด้านการทำธุรกิจ
7.หากมีประสบการณ์ด้านการสอนจะได้รับการพิจารณาเป็นกรณีพิเศษ
8. มีความสามารถในการใช้ภาษาอังกฤษ ฟัง พูด อ่าน เขียน ได้ดี
9. มีบุคลิกภาพและมนุษยสัมพันธ์ดี
10. ทักษะในการสื่อสาร เพื่อสร้างความเข้าใจและสัมพันธภาพที่ดีกับบุคคลรอบข้าง
11. คล่องแคล่ว มีปฏิภาณไหวพริบในการแก้ไขปัญหา
12.พร้อมรับการเปลี่ยนแปลงมีความสามารถในการปรับตัวและพัฒนาตนเองให้เหมาะกับบริบทที่เปลี่ยนแปลงและทันสมัยตลอดเวลา อัตราเงินเดือน 18,000 - 28,500 บาท จำนวน 1 ตำแหน่ง สวัสดิการ 1. ประกันสังคม
 2. ประกันอุบัติเหตุ
 3. ประกันสุขภาพ(กลุ่ม)
 4. ตรวจสุขภาพประจำปี
 5. กองทุนสำรองเลี้ยงชีพ

School Location The school is conveniently located within walking distance from Queen Sirikit or Khlong Toei MRT stations in the heart of central Bangkok. South African applicants must have a valid TOEIC score of 800+. Non-native speakers who complied with the requirements. Job_Title: EYFS class teacher and Head of Year - Nursery
Job_Description: Rugby School Thailand (RST), a co-educational day and boarding international School set in 80 acres of glorious Thai countryside south of Bangkok, opened in September 2017 with 110 students. The School has now grown to over 1,100 students and attracts students from all over Thailand and South East Asia. The structure, School day and ethos of RST are based upon the British Independent School model, rather than the standard international school model. As such, the School has three sections: Pre-Prep (2-6 year olds), Prep (7 – 12 year olds) and Senior (13 – 18 year olds). Rugby School Thailand is the first overseas sister school of Rugby School UK, one of the most prestigious and well-known schools in the UK. Rugby School Thailand shares Rugby School UK’s DNA in every important respect. It is unique. The health, safety and well-being of young people are of paramount importance to all the adults who work at Rugby School Thailand. Children have the right to protection, regardless of age, gender, race, culture, sexual orientation, or disability. They have a right to be safe in our School. Members of staff in the School have a legal and moral obligation to safeguard and promote the welfare of the students, taking all reasonable steps to protect them from harm whether from physical injury, abuse, neglect, emotional harm or from anything that interferes with their general development. About School/Department The Pre-Prep comprises 5 year groups: Pre-Nursery, Nursery, Reception, Year 1 and Year 2. There are currently 300 children in the Pre-Prep. The average size of a class is 16 for Early Years and 20 for KS1. The capacity of the Pre-Prep is 320. The normal School day runs from 8 am to 15.15, with Activities and After School Care offered thereafter until 16:45. Rugby School Thailand Pre-Prep has its own classroom building with a capacity of 320 children. It houses 20 spacious classrooms each with its own additional collaboration area, as well as dedicated spaces for Music, Library, Soft Play, EAL and Learning Support. A large multi-purpose Hall can be configured for music/drama performances, assemblies, and indoor activities. An internal courtyard (The Oval) complete with tepee has been designed as an area for reflection, quiet games, reading and small group work. Immediately outside the Pre-Prep there is a shaded activity area, which is also accessible via a slide from the upper floor! This incorporates age-appropriate climbing frames, a dedicated Nursery play area, multi-use games area, and a track for ‘balance bikes’. Adjacent to this area the Pre-Prep has its own heated learner swimming pool with beach entry and water splash zone; and just beyond this lies our extensive grass playing fields. Closing date: 2 February 2024 Application Process (Rugby School Thailand reserves the right to appoint by invitation before the closing date.) Please apply through the TES website. Should you wish to have an informal conversation or if you have further questions, please email the Head of Pre-Prep, Mrs Sarah Shuttleworth, at sshuttleworth@rugbyschool.ac.th Qualifications, Identification, Health and Background Checks Rugby School Thailand is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all the students in our care and expects all applicants to share this commitment. You will be required to bring documentation to interview providing proof of your identity, including an attested (by a notary) birth certificate, and qualifications. If successful at interview the position will be offered subject to satisfactory references and police checks. For candidates who have worked and/or lived in the UK, we will request that you have an up to date ICPC and we will complete Prohibition Order Checks. We also require that anyone who has lived and worked in a country other than the UK for more than 6 months has a police check from the national checking agency. All references will be verified, we require a minimum of two references with one reference from your present or most recent employer. You may also be required, within the final appointment process, to undergo a health check. Rugby School Thailand is an equal opportunities employer.

Primary Instructional Coach For August 2024, Bangkok Patana School seeks an Instructional Coach to join our Primary School. This new and pivotal position underscores our commitment to enhancing teacher capacity and supporting student growth. The role This position offers the successful candidate the opportunity to further develop their instructional practice and middle leadership skills, working alongside all year teams in a large and vibrant international school. You may already have knowledge and understanding of coaching approaches, or you may be a leading teacher within your current setting. You will certainly be an excellent classroom practitioner who has developed the knowledge and skills to share and develop practice of colleagues with support, constructive challenge, and effective feedback. The Instructional Coach has three primary areas of responsibility: In the strategic domain, you will collaborate with the Primary Leadership Team (PLT) and middle leaders, leveraging student data analysis to inform development strategies and action plans. Additionally, you will provide expertise in instructional practices, lead Continuous Professional Learning initiatives, and support new staff onboarding. In the instructional realm, you will work closely with teachers across the Primary school, assisting in instructional decision-making, modelling effective strategies, team teaching, and providing coaching feedback. You will also contribute to lesson and curriculum planning as well as celebrating student learning through events like the annual 3-way conference. Operationally, you will ensure high-quality provision and seamless day-to-day operations of the Primary school by managing all staff absences, allocating necessary cover, and line managing the cover team. Additionally, this role will require the successful candidate to teach, across various classes, with a timetable of up to 50%. Is this a good fit for you? The ideal candidate for will possess a unique blend of qualities that align with the dynamic nature of the role. Above all, you will love working with children, be committed to establishing positive relationships and exhibit a genuine, warm and open approach. Strong collaboration and communication skills are essential, as the candidate will work closely with the Primary Leadership Team, middle leaders, and teachers to drive positive change in teaching practices. You will be data informed, innovative and with a solution-focused mindset, enabling you to contribute effectively to the development of teaching strategies and action plans. Effective organisational and time management skills are paramount to managing the Primary school’s cover requirements. This component of the role will require the successful candidate to start their daily early and be strategic in assigning cover for unplanned and planned absences. Application Process: Interested candidates are requested to apply through the TES portal. In your application, please include a bespoke and personalised letter address to Primary Principal Sarah McCormack, which outlines your vision and values, experience, skills/attributes and qualifications which enable you to meet the requirements as detailed in the job description. Bangkok Patana is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students and expects all staff to share the same commitment. Extensive checks (DBS if UK based) and references will form part of the application process. We offer a competitive salary with a generous benefits package. To work with the subject coordinators to develop the curriculum in each area on a regular and ongoing basis. Pupil Tracking and Progress To liaise with the Head of Phase to run termly pupil progress meetings in conjunction with the Head of Phase. To use termly assessment data to identify students who are underachieving and liaise with subject coordinators, Learning Support Coordinators and Heads of Phase to put in place appropriate interventions for individual students. To work with their team to identify students who may have previously unidentified learning needs and to liaise with the Learning Support and EAL staff and Head of Phase regarding appropriate provision in line with the EAL and Learning Support policies. To deliver to the Head of Phase termly assessment data for input into the assessment database. Communication with Parents To oversee the production of the Curriculum Letter each half term and ensure that it is received in good time by parents. To be responsible for managing the Homework Database for their year group and to ensure that it is being used appropriately by staff and parents. To ensure that parents are aware of their role as Year Leader. Pastoral Care of Students Class teachers are the first point of contact for parents. However, if issues arise and parents feel they would like contact with a more senior staff member, the Year leader will be the next point of contact To make themselves available at short notice to meet with parents who may have concerns about students in their year group. To meet parents and listen to their concerns. To be able to identify which issues can be dealt with by the Year Leader and which need the involvement of the Head of Phase. To liaise with class teachers and where necessary Heads of Phase over pastoral issues. To lead Meet the Teacher evenings and transition meetings at the start and end of each year. Behaviour Management of Students Class teachers should deal with the vast majority of behaviour management issues in line with school policies and procedures. Year Leaders should offer support to class teachers in relation to behaviour management and liaise with the Head of Phase where they feel additional support or involvement of parents is required. Induction of New Staff To ensure that new teaching staff are provided with the appropriate classroom resources they need at the start of the year. To ensure new staff are aware of important calendar dates, school events, and staff meetings. To liaise with the Head of Phase to ensure new staff are familiar with the policies and procedures in the Early Years and Primary Staff Handbook. To be a point of contact for new staff and to answer questions in relation to day-to-day matters. Reports Overall responsibility for setting out the timetable for reporting each term is with the Head of Phase. Heads of Department for Music, PE and Languages are responsible for ensuring that specialist reports are completed on time and placed in the folders by the deadline. The Year Leaders’ responsibility is as follows To organise their team to peer read reports prior to the deadline to identify any typographical and other administration errors and to identify any incomplete reports. To read reports from each teacher in their team prior to delivery to the Head of Phase to ensure an appropriate tone is being used. To liaise with the Head of Phase about concerns connected with the reports. Year Leaders Team The Year Leaders for Years 1-6 and the Early Years Coordinator are members of the Year Leaders Team led and managed by the Head of Early Years and Key Stage 1. The role of this team is to work with subject leaders for each subject to ensure continuity and progression across Early Years and Primary in each curriculum area. Year Leaders will be required to Attend regular meetings of the team usually before school. Review planning across the year groups. Review students’ work across the year groups. Identify areas for improvement and feed into the School Improvement Plan. Day to Day Management To liaise with other Year Leaders to establish an effective library timetable from the start of Term 1 each year. To notify the Head of Phase of cover requirements for their team known in advance e.g. courses, medical appointments, observations. Act as a point of contact between team members and specialist teachers in relation to timetable changes, music concerts and sports matches/events affecting their year group. To act as a point of contact for the year group in relation to school events such as International Day, Fun Day and the Christmas Concert. To notify the Head of Phase of calendar dates such as school trips and class assemblies. To organise school trips and notify the office in accordance with school policies and procedures. To lead staff in organising year group and teacher assemblies in accordance with the rota each year. To carry out other duties to ensure the smooth running of the year group in accordance with the instructions of the Head of Phase.

The School founder Ms. Pattamon Mekavarakul The school founder, Ms. Pattamon Mekavarakul has successfully built and run a world class award-winning five star beachfront resort in Thailand called ‘Cape Dara Resort’. In 2019, she went through big changes in her life and learned much about life in a way that she had not encountered before. She wished that from a young age she had an opportunity to learn life strategies and to be better equipped to tackle whatever challenges life brings. Her realisation that “PERFECTION DOES NOT GUARANTEE HAPPINESS. WE, OURSELVES, CAN CREATE HAPPINESS AND LIVE LIFE THE WAY WE THINK WE DESERVE” led her to understand that the best time to plant thinking processes and strategies into one’s life is from 0-6 years old, the time when we absorb everything and form humanity in our hearts. Therefore, she started her kindergarten project in 2021 with a strong passion to create: ”a generation that is humane, happy, responsible, and capable, who will one day become high quality citizens of the world, who will not be not harmful to themselves or others, know their rights and get to lead the life they deserve.” Lovell International School is designed and built with the aim to enhance the most crucial skill of the alpha generation, EF (Executive Function). The skill that will help them overcome difficulties/boredom/challenges in order to achieve their goals. All the school facilities including the 12 classrooms are designed to enhance brain development and motor skills such as swimming pool, splash pool, gym, dance studio, cooking class, art studio, musical wall, in/outdoor playgrounds, and a family library for parents and children to build a lifelong learning community together. The harmony of the learning environment comes from a blend of established big trees and other natural elements such as a bug hotel, keyhole, flower garden with butterfly farm, the green kitchen, and many varieties of edible plants and vegetables for the children to explore. The school curriculum uses the British Early Years Foundation stage (EYFS) and National Curriculum blended with the philosophy of Reggio Emilia.

Regent's International School, Bangkok is one of the leading British International Schools in Thailand. We are accredited by the Council of International Schools (CIS) and are members of the Federation of British International Schools in Asia (FOBISIA). We are also proud members of the Round Square organisation of schools. We are pleased to be accepting applications from excellent teachers who specialise in Psychology and have experience of delivering the subject at either IB or A Level. Experience of or willingness to teach the subject at GCSE is also desirable as it is our ambition to introduce this subject at KS4. The successful candidate may also be required to teach another subject such as Global Citizenship (our Regent's PSHE curriculum) and will be a form tutor as part of our House system. Candidates should be able to demonstrate both a high level of subject knowledge but also be committed to the wider, holistic development of our wonderful students. About Regent's International School, Bangkok Regent's International School, Bangkok is a well-known and highly regarded international school based in the Thai capital, Bangkok. Founded by prominent educator and leader, Dr. Virachai Techavijit in the 1990's, Regent's has become one of the most popular schools in the region and is rooted in its Thai and British heritage as well as international philosophy. As the first boarding school in Bangkok, we're proud of the excellent provision we provide for students who come to us from a number of countries. All staff are expected to play a role in the wider life of the school, including supporting boarders' activities. The school delivers a locally appropriate adjusted version of the British Curriculum with students taking International GCSEs at the age of 16 before most participate in the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IBDP) from 16 to 18. There are around 750 students across the school. The school enjoys well-maintained facilities which are purpose built. We are at an exciting stage of our journey and have just begun work on an ambitious, Whole School Strategic Plan. Current priorities for the Secondary School include: Curriculum redesign and development to ensure our offer is personalised to our diverse range of learners Development of the Regent's Teaching and Learning Vision and associated professional growth and development programme Ensuring that transitions across the different phases of our school enable students to participate in a fulfilling and successful learning journey Enhancing our home-school partnership Development of a fit-for-purpose PSHE curriculum in our ever changing world Developing Leadership at all levels across the school strategically, operationally and as a community attribute Reinvigorating our enrichment offer, trips and visits and our Round Square work in a post-pandemic world If you feel that this position is of interest and you have the right experience and skills and are ready for a fresh challenge we would love to hear from you. Along with a monthly salary paid in local currency, we offer an attractive two year compensation package (renewable) which includes benefits such as: Flight allowance including return airfares at the start and end of contract and an annual airfare allowance following the first two year contract period Arrival allowance Housing allowance / provision Access to professional development opportunities, both external and internally provided 100% scholarship on school fees for up to two dependents (an application for remission for further dependents can be made to the Principal) Health insurance including worldwide cover. To find out more: Connect with our website and - in particular - our social media feeds on Facebook and Instagram which will give potential applicants an up to date feel for our wonderful school and our work Download the attached information pack and job description Watch this short film introducing our school https://youtu.be/4ZZgyeF4Si4?feature=shared In addition, this website will give you an idea of the cost of living in Bangkok in relation to London. It can be adjusted to your current city. https://www.numbeo.com/cost-of-living/compare_cities.jsp?country1=United+Kingdom&country2=Thailand&city1=London&city2=Bangkok If you like what you read and see and would like to apply to come and work with us, please do so using the TES Application form or by sending a full CV and Letter of Application outlining why you would like to work at our school and what you can offer our community to the Head of School - kirsten.prescott@regents.ac.th Interviews will be conducted online. Early applications are encouraged as strong candidates may be interviewed prior to the closing date. We reserve the right to close the advert early should an appointment be confirmed. We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of students and expect all staff to share this commitment. Appointment is subject to safeguarding checks and all employees are expected to comply with our school Child Protection and Safeguarding Policy and Code of Conduct.

A suitably qualified, dynamic and enthusiastic EYFS Coordinator is sought for Southern International School Hat Yai, a rapidly growing, co-educational, pre-school to age 18 Cambridge International School in the prosperous and friendly southern Thai city of Hat Yai. We are an accredited examination centre for Cambridge International Examinations and received the ISQM Silver accreditation through the Education Development Trust in June 2019.  We are also the first whole school with nursery in Thailand to be awarded the 'Quality Counts' mark at Platinum level, the highest possible level by the National Day Nurseries Association, (NDNA). Southern International School Hat Yai (SIH) is a young and ambitious school with a ‘can-do’ attitude and we are looking for a teacher who can bring a love of learning to the classroom, develop enquiring minds and inspire our students to achieve the best results possible. The successful candidate will be joining the school at a very exciting phase of its continuing development, and they will play a significant role in shaping the EYFS curriculum provision. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced teacher to build on the development of the department over recent years and lead a wonderful group of staff. The School follows the Framework for the English Early Years Foundation Stage. The successful candidate will ideally have previous leadership experience in an Early Years department. It is essential for applicants to: have experience of working within their respective area be appropriately qualified (e.g. B.Ed. or a first degree and a PGCE) current knowledge and expertise in leading assessment of the new framework It is desirable for applicants to have: •        experience of working in the international sector •        experience of leadership in an Early Years department Please upload an updated CV as part of your application. Our children are mostly Thai and from other Asian countries with parents who are committed to giving their children an international education. Our parents are extremely loyal and supportive and participate in many school events and activities. The successful candidate will be joining the school at an exciting period in its development. There are opportunities to develop yourself professionally and personally in a safe, happy, supportive environment. Hat Yai in Songkhla province has grown from a small but busy commercial town into a lively but manageable city of a little over a million, surrounded by rice paddies, forested hills and waterfalls. The tourist hot spots of Krabi, Trang and Phuket are easily accessible for long weekend trips, but there are several unspoiled destinations much closer to home. New upmarket bistros and restaurants are springing up seemingly overnight, adding to the cosmopolitan feel of this welcoming city. Accommodation is cheap and varied, from Thai-style houses to newly built, self-contained condominiums with shared swimming pools. Hat Yai is a wonderful, safe city that provides a great quality of life, and this partly explains why so many of our staff choose to renew their contracts. Please look at our Facebook page to get a feel for working in SIH and living in Southern Thailand. NOTE: We reserve the right to interview and offer to a strong candidate prior to the closing date. It is strongly recommended that candidates submit their applications as soon as possible. Southern International School is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. Please note that should your application be successful a police check will be undertaken in the country of origin; in the UK, a disclosure will be requested from the UK’s Disclosure and Barring Service.

School Details – At HeadStart we aim to stimulate students’ minds, as well as to encourage them to push beyond perceived traditional academic boundaries. It is our intention that through employing dedicated, enthusiastic and inspiring teachers, we will enthuse all our students to reach their potential and exceed expectations. We deliver a well-rounded personalised educational experience. We pride ourselves in being a community school, emphasising individual learning. HeadStart is based in the centre of Phuket Island and gained ‘International School’ status in 2010 and is a fully accredited International School with The Education Development Trust. In our most recent inspection, we were awarded the International Schools Quality Mark (ISQM) with accreditors recognising the school to be a ‘Good School with Outstanding Features’. Our curriculum is based on the national curriculum of England and we offer Cambridge & Pearson qualifications in Secondary including IGCSEs, A Levels and BTECs. The school's main campus at Chaofah has 960 students on roll and is oversubscribed in most year groups. In August 2023 we opened a new campus in the north of the island in Cherngtalay. This is a single form entry Foundation and Primary school for up to 200 students. In August 2024 the school will expand to become a two form entry school from Preschool to Year 9. Drama Teacher – We are looking to appoint a motivated and enthusiastic Drama teacher for a start in April 2024. We may be able to delay the start date until August 2024 for the right candidate. The successful candidate will have experience in teaching across the Secondary age range. They should be an inspiring teacher who can bring the subject alive. Experience of teaching the Cambridge IGCSE syllabus would be an advantage. We are looking for a highly committed team player with drive, energy and passion, who will inspire a love of learning within their pupils. A good sense of humour and an excellent work ethic are essential. Remuneration Package: (Full details of salary package and terms and conditions will be sent to short-listed candidates) · Private medical insurance · 3 year renewable contract · Free lunch and beverages during the school day · Additional payment for extra curricula activities · Significant end of contract bonuses. In addition, please also state in your email whether you are able to commence work on the 22nd of April, or whether you would prefer an August 2024 start. The closing date for applications is Friday 26th January 2024; however, we encourage early applications and reserve the right to make an appointment to the ideal candidate before this date. Job_Description: TSIS is a rapidly expanding and flourishing British-style international school with CIS membership. We are a multi-national, multi-cultural, English-medium school community. Our Secondary campus caters for students in Years 7 - 13, where they undertake CIE IGCSEs in Years 10 and 11, and choose either CIE A Levels or the TSIS Diploma Programme (or a hybrid of the two) during Years 12 and 13. The Secondary campus is located on the south-eastern edge of Bangkok on a large, green, well appointed campus. Garden International School, Bangkok seeks a new Head of First School to commence in August 2024. We are looking for an energetic, innovative and enthusiastic professional with experience of leading a successful team. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a thriving and well-established school. Garden International School, Bangkok offers a premium international education, based on the British education model, in a friendly, family orientated environment. The school is located in the Sathorn district, close to Lumpini Park in the centre of Bangkok. We have children represented by over 40 countries, immersing all students in a rich diversity of cultures, religions and backgrounds. The school is accredited by Edu Development Trust and has received the International Schools Quality Mark. We are also accredited by Cambridge International Examinations, Oxford AQA International Examinations and the Thai Ministry of Education (ONESQA). We are affiliated to the International Schools Association of Thailand (ISAT) and the Federation of British International Schools in Asia (FOBISIA). Garden International School, Bangkok is a coeducational school of around 440 students, with classes from Pre-Nursery to Year 13. The school has a wonderful sense of community and class sizes are generally small, with the students well behaved, engaged in their learning and supported by their families. The First School campus houses Pre-Nursery to Year 1 classes and is two form entry. In EYFS, we closely follow the Development Matters EYFS Curriculum.  We are play-based in our learning approach and our students enjoy a child-centred learning experience. In Reception, our Read Write Inc programme begins and we adopt a Mastery approach in Mathematics. We have a fantastic community focus and our indoor and outdoor classroom areas provide an engaging learning environment. Each class in EYFS is supported by two teaching assistants and teachers work collaboratively as a year group team in our two form entry school. Bangkok is a vibrant and modern capital city, which has all the international standard amenities you would expect to find, but it also retains wonderful historical districts that allow residents of Bangkok to immerse themselves in Thailand’s history. Thailand is an exciting country with rich cultural experiences; it is a beautiful part of the world with year-round sun and is a safe place to work overseas. The cost of living is very reasonable and teachers tend to avail themselves of high-quality holiday experiences around the region. The health, safety and well-being of all of the students at Garden International School, Bangkok is the foremost concern of all of the adults employed by the school. Our students have the right to be protected Our students have the right to be safe in our school Our students have the right to be respected and listened to Appointed applicants from the United Kingdom are to provide an International Child Protection Certificate (UK) (refer: http://www.acro.police.uk/ICPC/). Full police clearance, covering at least the previous 10 years, is necessary for all appointees who are working, or who have worked, in countries outside the United Kingdom. Garden International School, Bangkok offers: An attractive salary Health insurance and accident insurance Expected annual performance related bonus of up to one month’s salary Housing allowance Baggage allowance (for Overseas Hire Contracts) Flights from London (for Overseas Hire Contracts) at the start of the two-year contract and to London at the completion of the two-year contract. Flights are also provided for legal spouse and up to two dependent children Two year contract (renewable on mutual agreement) Tuition Fee remission for up to two dependent children For more information on the school please visit our website, www.gardenbangkok.com or our facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/Garden.International.School.Bangkok/. Applicants who would like to experience the rewards of working at our school should send a statement of application, addressed to Mr. David Butcher, of no more than two pages highlighting their strengths as a leader and how those strengths will benefit our students, a full Curriculum Vitae (including photograph) and the names and email addresses of three professional referees through the TES apply now system. Initial Interviews will take place via Zoom or in Bangkok. Early applications are encouraged and applications will be assessed as they arrive. We reserve the right to close the selection process early should an exceptional candidate be identified at an early stage.

A Whole School Music teacher is sought for Southern International School Hat Yai, a rapidly growing, co-educational, pre-school to age 18 Cambridge International School in the prosperous and friendly southern Thai city of Hat Yai. We are an accredited examination centre for Cambridge International Examinations and received the ISQM Silver accreditation through the Education Development Trust in June 2019.  We are also the first whole school with nursery in Thailand to be awarded the 'Quality Counts' mark at Platinum level, the highest possible level by the National Day Nurseries Association, (NDNA). Southern International School Hat Yai (SIH) is a young and ambitious school with a ‘can-do’ attitude and we are looking for a teacher who can bring a love of learning to the classroom, develop enquiring minds and inspire our students to achieve the best results possible. Music is very prominent across all sections of the school. Our annual school productions, Thai cultural events and performances allow us to fully showcase the musical abilities of our students. The successful candidate will be joining the school at a very exciting phase of its continuing development and they will play a significant role in shaping the Music curriculum provision across all sections of the school moving forward into next academic year. The successful candidate will ideally have whole-school experience of teaching Music from KS1 to KS4. The successful candidate should: Hold a BA Music related degree plus a post-graduate qualification in education (i.e. PGCE/GTP/Teach First route) Have a minimum of two years teaching experience in the UK or overseas in a British curriculum school Have a proven track record of excellent classroom and pedagogical practice Have a thorough knowledge of the Primary & Secondary Music English National Curriculum Have a good ability to use IT to support teaching and learning Be able to engage, motivate and support children, staff and parents Be a reflective practitioner with the ability to think creatively and innovate Be a positive and enthusiastic member of the staff room Please upload an updated CV as part of your application. Our children are mostly Thai and from other Asian countries with parents who are committed to giving their children an international education. Our parents are extremely loyal and supportive and participate in many school events and activities. The successful candidate will be joining the school at an exciting period in its development. There are opportunities to develop yourself professionally and personally in a safe, happy, supportive environment. Hat Yai in Songkhla province has grown from a small but busy commercial town into a lively but manageable city of a little over a million, surrounded by rice paddies, forested hills and waterfalls. The tourist hot spots of Krabi, Trang and Phuket are easily accessible for long weekend trips, but there are several unspoiled destinations much closer to home. New upmarket bistros and restaurants are springing up seemingly overnight, adding to the cosmopolitan feel of this welcoming city. Accommodation is cheap and varied, from Thai-style houses to newly built, self-contained condominiums with shared swimming pools. Hat Yai is a wonderful, safe city that provides a great quality of life, and this partly explains why so many of our staff choose to renew their contracts. Job_Title: Assistant Professor or Associate Professor, SERD-GDS
Job_Description:
Assistant/Associate Professor Level
 Gender Development Studies
 Department of Development and Sustainability (DDS)
 School of Environment, Resources, and Development Applications are invited for the position of Assistant / Associate Professor in Gender and Development Studies, Department Development and Sustainability of the School of Environment, Resources, and Development, Asian Institute of Technology (AIT). Pathumthani, Thailand. AIT is an international, non-profit post-graduate institution, promoting technological change and sustainable development in the Asia-Pacific region through higher learning focusing on critical global issues through research, outreach, and capacity development. Established in 1959, AIT became a leading regional institution actively working with public and private sector partners throughout the region and with some of the top universities in the world. The institute offers Master's and Doctoral degrees, postgraduate diplomas, and certificate programs in engineering, science, planning, and management, and serves over 2,300 students from Asia and beyond. Its teaching faculty, staff, researchers, and students are composed of more than 40 different nationalities and diverse ethnic backgrounds forms a unique international community in the institute’s residential campus situated 42 kilometers north of Bangkok. The Department of Development and Sustainability invites applications for a faculty position in the Gender and Development Studies. The candidate should have significant teaching, research and/or practical experiences. The successful candidates are expected to develop and teach postgraduate courses, supervise Master’s and Doctoral students, conduct independent research, and carry out consultancy and outreach activities. The Department of Development and Sustainability aims to respond to emerging challenges to sustainable development in Asia. Asia is changing rapidly economically, socially, politically as well as culturally. In order to effectively address emerging issues in the region, we need to have a critical and deep analysis of contexts under a multiplicity of identities – be it by gender, religion, ethnicity, class, age, geographical location, livelihood, nation, etc. The region urgently needs people who are able to organize a multi-disciplinary approach to problem-solving, with in-depth understanding and responsiveness to the various needs of local women and men. We strive to generate research and knowledge to meet these needs. Requirements: Ph.D., with a specialization in a relevant Social Science field such as Gender/Women's Studies; Development Studies; Sociology; Anthropology; Environment and Society studies; Communication; Economics; Political Science; International Relations. Applicants with teaching, research and/or practical experience in gender and development studies, with specialization in any of the following or related areas: migration/ displacement, environment, politics, technology, globalization, social justice are encouraged to apply. Ability to publish in international refereed journals, excellent communication skills and experience in obtaining research grants in international competition are highly desirable. Relevant experience and competence in the field of gender and development in teaching and student supervision at graduate level with excellent oral and written communication skills in English. An interdisciplinary approach and ability to work collaboratively with program and university colleagues in an international setting. Job Responsibilities: Independently teach a minimum of 3 to 4 postgraduate courses per year in GDS Collaborate on curriculum development and program administration with faculty colleagues, including development of new relevant course(s) and research programs as necessary Supervise Master and Doctoral student’s thesis/dissertation research Conduct own research and publish research results in academic outlets. Participate in and collaborate on outreach projects that advance gender-responsiveness in development. Garden International School, Bangkok seeks a new Head of Primary School to commence in August 2024. We are looking for an energetic, innovative and enthusiastic professional with experience of leading a successful team. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a thriving and well-established school. Please read the attached Head of Primary Job Description and Person Specification for more details. Garden International School, Bangkok offers a premium international education, based on the British education model, in a friendly, family orientated environment. The school is located in the Sathorn district, close to Lumpini Park in the centre of Bangkok. We have children represented by over 40 countries, immersing all students in a rich diversity of cultures, religions and backgrounds. The school is accredited by Edu Development Trust and has received the International Schools Quality Mark. We are also accredited by Cambridge International Examinations, Oxford AQA International Examinations and the Thai Ministry of Education (ONESQA). We are affiliated to the International Schools Association of Thailand (ISAT) and the Federation of British International Schools in Asia (FOBISIA). Garden International School, Bangkok is a coeducational school of around 440 students, with classes from Pre-Nursery to Year 13. The school has a wonderful sense of community and class sizes are generally small, with the students well behaved, engaged in their learning and supported by their families. In Primary we use up to date, world-class approaches to teach core curriculum subjects including Maths Mastery, Text Based Literacy, Read Write Inc Phonics and Whole Class Guided Reading. We have developed a cross curricular programme for learning which enables students to see the connections across subjects, ensuring high engagement in learning. Bangkok is a vibrant and modern capital city, which has all the international standard amenities you would expect to find, but it also retains wonderful historical districts that allow residents of Bangkok to immerse themselves in Thailand’s history. Thailand is an exciting country with rich cultural experiences; it is a beautiful part of the world with year-round sun and is a safe place to work overseas. The cost of living is very reasonable and teachers tend to avail themselves of high-quality holiday experiences around the region. The health, safety and well-being of all of the students at Garden International School, Bangkok is the foremost concern of all of the adults employed by the school. Our students have the right to be protected Our students have the right to be safe in our school Our students have the right to be respected and listened to Appointed applicants from the United Kingdom are to provide an International Child Protection Certificate (UK) (refer: http://www.acro.police.uk/ICPC/). Full police clearance, covering at least the previous 10 years, is necessary for all appointees who are working, or who have worked, in countries outside the United Kingdom. Garden International School, Bangkok offers: An attractive salary Health insurance and accident insurance Expected annual performance related bonus of up to one month’s salary Housing allowance Baggage allowance (for Overseas Hire Contracts) Flights from London (for Overseas Hire Contracts) at the start of the two-year contract and to London at the completion of the two-year contract. Flights are also provided for legal spouse and up to two dependent children Two year contract (renewable on mutual agreement) Tuition Fee remission for up to two dependent children For more information on the school please visit our website, www.gardenbangkok.com or our facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/Garden.International.School.Bangkok/. Applicants who would like to experience the rewards of working at our school should send a statement of application, addressed to Mr. David Butcher, of no more than two pages highlighting their strengths as a leader and how those strengths will benefit our students, a full Curriculum Vitae (including photograph) and the names and email addresses of three professional referees through the TES apply now system. Initial Interviews will take place via Zoom or in Bangkok. Early applications are encouraged and applications will be assessed as they arrive. We reserve the right to close the selection process early should an exceptional candidate be identified at an early stage.

Full-time Literacy / EFL Teachers Posted
 
 7 hours ago I Can Read is a large multi-national learning organisation operating for over 20 years. We specialise in the teaching of English literacy skills as well as general EFL content. We have over 20 centres currently in Thailand with plans for future expansion. Successful applicants will be required to teach phonological skills and reading, writing, speaking and listening skills using the specially-developed I Can Read System to classes of no more than 10 students. Training and all lesson plans and materials are provided. Students are typically between 3-12 years old so applicants must be comfortable with teaching these age groups. We are looking for native speakers from Australia, New Zealand, United Kingdom, United States, Canada, Ireland and South Africa with the following: • A completed bachelor's or higher degree. • A TEFL/TESOL/CELTA certificate (120 hours minimum). • Clear speech with a universally understandable accent. (This is essential for the teaching of phonology.) • Experience teaching or working with children. *Please see the additional notes at the bottom of the posting for further details. Position and Contract Details: Full-time: 5 days per week - 3 weekdays (13:00 - 19:00) plus Saturday and Sunday (9:00 - 18:00). All positions have two consecutive weekdays off per week. • 24-month duration • Post-probation salary THB 48,000 per month (before tax and Social Security deductions). (This amount may vary depending on location, experience and qualifications when an offer is made to suitable candidates.) • Training and contract completion bonuses. • Visa and work permit reimbursement and application assistance. • Ongoing professional development. • Social Security and medical cover. We are currently seeking teachers for these locations: • Bangkok Metropolitan Area - Central Pinklao / Crystal Park (Ekkamai-Ramintra) / Fashion Island / Future Park Rangsit / Index Living Mall Rama 2 Before commencement of a position, applicants must complete our 5-day training programme in Bangkok. Unless specified, roles are usually required to start ASAP or within one month following its completion. Interested applicants must apply for the position with an email including the following details and attachments: • The type of work you are seeking (full-time or part-time). • Preferred location(s) (if any location is fine please state this instead). • Details on your availability and current visa status and expiry. • An up-to-date copy of your resume/CV. • Scans of any necessary qualifications. • A valid passport copy or recent photograph. Due to the high volume of applications we regret that only candidates who have been selected for an interview will receive a response. We look forward to hearing from you soon. Recruitment I Can Read System (Thailand) Email: recruitment@icanread.asia Website: www.icanread.asia/thailand *Additional Notes: • All educational documents listed are essential for obtaining a visa and work permit with our company. They must be original hard copies from recognised and accredited tertiary institutions. Scanned copies and digital certificates are not eligible for processing in Thailand by the Immigration Bureau and other ministries. • Degrees must be legalised for use in Thailand via a process involving the Thai embassy or consulate in the country where the qualification was obtained or in some cases through the country’s embassy or consulate in Thailand. Applicants are responsible for checking the requirements specific to their circumstances and completing the processes prior to commencing work but our staff can provide advice and support as necessary. • We may at times accept applicants from non-native speaking countries only if they have spent a substantial amount of time studying or working in native-speaking countries. Such applicants and South Africans must have a TOIEC Listening and Reading certificate completed within the last 2 years (or if not, be willing to obtain one at an approved testing centre in Thailand). • Applicants must be prepared to teach online and onsite in centres as required and need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. The Role We are seeking an experienced and dynamic University Counsellor to join our growing counselling team, to work within the Sixth Form team. The ideal candidate will specialise in guiding students through the application process for international universities, especially the USA, leveraging their extensive knowledge of the higher education system to support our student body. They also will have experience in mentoring students on their EPQs and careers. This role demands a deep understanding of the nuances of university admissions, including standardised testing requirements, essay writing, scholarship opportunities, and the holistic admission process. The University Counsellor must also subscribe fully to the core values of the school, demonstrate a commitment to a positive and inclusive school culture, and work collaboratively with a diverse group of stakeholders, including students, parents, teachers, and administrators. Remuneration The successful candidate will receive excellent salary and benefits commensurate with their experience. This will include: Competitive salary. On-site accommodation (if recruited from overseas) for first year of contract at least. Option to move off-site and receive housing allowance from the second year. Start and end of contract flights (for dependent spouse and children too). Annual flight allowance (for dependent spouse and children too). Medical insurance (for dependent spouse and children too). 100% Tuition fees contribution for up to two children, three for teaching couples (50% for subsequent children). An end of contract gratuity. How to Apply In order to apply, please consider the details of the Candidate Information Pack, complete all sections of the application form including the supporting statement that sets out your interest in this position, how you meet the requirements of the role and your ambitions for the school. The closing date for applications is Friday 26th January, 2024 . Applications will be considered upon receipt so early applications are encouraged. Safeguarding Denla British School is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and expects all staff to respect this commitment. The post is subject to an appropriate criminal background check from your home country and also the country you are currently working in, and satisfactory reference checks (which will be followed up by a phone call to each referee). It is essential that one reference should be completed by your current headteacher.

Kajonkiet International School, Phuket (KIS) is a co-educational day school for children aged 2-18 years. With ambitions to become one of the region’s top-performing schools providing an exhilarating international education, we are seeking to appoint outstanding specialist teachers for the Academic Year 2024/25, who would like to be part of this exciting project. The closing date for applications is Tuesday 30 January 2024, although interested teachers are encouraged to submit applications as soon as possible as, if an ideal applicant is identified we may appoint immediately.
